children.value: Critieria used by customer to choose amongst different options available?
How price sensitive are the customers?
How much are customer ready to pay for this additional value?
What features make our product better than the next best alternative?
Can we sell different versions of the medicine at different price points?
Pricing model preference, if any? -- value-based, cost-based or competition-based.
Any possible cross-sell / upsell that we should take into account when pricing this specific medicine?
Any additional storage requirements that might add to cost?
It is important to understand if the client has a preference for any pricing models? If not, value-based pricing is most common and we can proceed with it.

Customers have an idea of how much it would be reasonable to pay for a product, with this being quantified as an expected price. Perceived value is fundamentally personal and different individuals will be willing to pay different prices for the same product.
